Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the tweets were posted by the GoAir employee Asif Khan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Twitter account @MdAsif35534489 belongs to the GoAir employee Asif Khan without concrete proof.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation presented by Asif Khan himself, who denies any association with the Twitter account and claims to be falsely targeted.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that GoAir terminated the employment contract of Asif Khan based on the assumption that he was responsible for the tweets.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of the false accusations on Asif Khan and his family, as mentioned in his Facebook post.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing a comprehensive investigation into the matter before taking action against Asif Khan.
Exaggerate: There is no clear evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
